history.notes: Initial release with TCC-compliant helper app, ScreenCaptureKit-based capture, dynamic Retina scaling, bundled cliclick, guided setup wizard

securityReview.notes: macOS-specific desktop automation skill requiring Screen Recording and Accessibility permissions. Uses vision-action loop to control GUI applications. Contains security gates for sensitive apps (banking, passwords). Helper app required for TCC permissions.

risks.issue: Screen Recording permission allows capturing all screen content including sensitive data
Accessibility permission allows mouse/keyboard control of any application
Vision-action loop could be tricked into interacting with malicious dialogs
Automated clicks could trigger unintended actions if screen state changes

recommendations: Always use security gates - stop and ask user before interacting with banking, password managers, or auth screens
Never skip verification step - always screenshot after action to confirm expected result
Limit to 3 retry attempts - prevent infinite loops on failure
Clean up screenshots - delete /tmp/pac_screen*.png after task completion
User approval required for sensitive operations - implement Step 1 Plan phase with explicit confirmation
Retina coordinate handling - use get-scale-factor command to get actual display scale
